articles.title: Hello World
articles.contents:
Hi! My name is Harry Fisher, thanks for visiting my site. I currently work as a Senior R Engineer at Seven Bridges. Previously, I have worked as a data scientist in pharmaceutical and financial crime and compliance sectors. I am very enthusiastic about the R programming language, and enjoy trying to solve challenging problems and learning new tricks. I‚Äôve also recently become a RStudio certified instructor for working with the tidyverse. I occasionally write about things I‚Äôm working and hopefully share interesting things on my blog. Feel free to get in touch if any of the posts catch your interest!
Research
In a different life, I completed my Ph.D. at Cardiff Metropolitan University where I was investigating risk factors associated with sports injury from an interdisciplinary perspective. Below are some research articles that I published along the way.
Fisher et al.¬†2020. An interdisciplinary examination of stress and injury in athletes. [Link]
Fisher et al.¬†2016. Relationship between Force Production during Isometric Squats and Knee Flexion Angles during Landing. Journal of Strength and Conditioning. [pdf]
Contact

Blog
My personal website / blog. Based on the distill theme by Rstudio.

articles.title: Software
articles.contents:
I enjoy tinkering with things in R - below are a few of my latest efforts!
R packages
{bitmexr}: R Client for the BitMEX Exchange 
An API wrapper for popular cryptocurrency exchange BitMEX. Buy and sell Bitcoin from the comfort of RStudio!
{poweRof10}: Tools to scrape data from www.thepowerof10.info 
Access data on performances from the UK‚Äôs athletic ranking website.
{qbr}: R interface to jQuery QueryBuilder 
A shiny widget useful for creating complex filter queries, built around the excellent queryBuilder jQuery library.
